name: Microtel Inn by Wyndham Newport News Airport

reviews.title: quaint hotel, great experience
reviews.text: I stayed here with my grandmother when she came down for my sister's graduation, and it was such a cute hotel. Very personable, polite people working there if you ever need anything and adorable rooms. Ours had an extremely comfortable window seat at the end of the room.

I needed a place to stay in Newport News for a few days to take care of family business. A relative suggested the Hampton Inn, but I thought the daily rate of $98.00 was too expensive so I checked this site for other hotels in the area which had good reviews and a reasonable price. I decided to stay at the Microtel Inn and booked the room via Travelocity since they had the cheapest daily rate of $48.00.
reviews.title: Good stay, great location

likes.liked: — Quiet and good location, continental breakfast
likes.disliked: — Hotel staff's failure to supply butter at the continental breakfast after guests requested it.

reviews.text: The room was smallish but very clean and suited my needs perfectly. The pillows are very flat so I requested a few extra ones and they were delivered promptly. All local and long distance calls were free so I didn't have to make costly long distance calls with my cell phone. There is no pool or exercise room, but free access to Bally's gym was available with my key card. The location is in close proximity to many popular restaurants, stores, and the Patrick Henry Shopping Mall.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The continental breakfast included waffles, danish, and bagels with cream cheese. The first morning I couldn't find any butter on the buffet table, so I asked the desk clerk to get it, but she said they ran out. The next morning I expected to have butter, figuring a hotel employee would have gone out to get it, but it wasn't there. At this point other guests were complaining about not having butter, so I figured the next morning it would be there, but
reviews.title: Fine for one night
Business travel/place to sleep only
reviews.text: it wasn't. I felt the hotel should not have let three days go by without supplying it and was disappointed.

I brought my laptop with me when I read there was wireless internet access, but it didn't work after the desk clerk showed me how to set it up on my computer. I have Windows Vista so it could have been my computer that was the problem. When I asked if other guests who have Vista got connected, the clerk didn't answer me, but he did tell me that wireless connections work only in certain areas of the hotel.
reviews.title: Courteous and Comfortable
Not quite "business" quality
reviews.text: This was our first time staying at a Microtel Inn. The chain is advertised as a budget business class hotel, but we didn't find it as such. The walls and floors are so thin you can hear the steps and noises from the hallway and the room above. The beds are hard and the pillows are so high but extra firm you will get a neckache and backache. Not at all comfortable. Bring your hairdryer because there aren't any in the rooms. I have not been in any hotels that do not provide a hairdryer in the room these days.
Would definitely not come back to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Do-it-yourself
Convenient, clean, and great price
reviews.text: We stayed at this Microtel last Friday (5/6/05). Upon arrival, our toilet stool was clogged and the room had no tv remote control. The front desk gave us a remote but said they would have to find the plunger for the toilet! Thirty minutes later we were given a plunger and told to un-clog the toilet ourselves! Another couple traveling with us had a room that had no hand towels, a burned out lightbulb and a sink without a drain stopper. An "Excellent" hotel/motel - I do not think so!

reviews.title: Another Happy and Satisfied Customer
reviews.text: We were thoroughly satisfied with this hotel. It was very convenient- you could safely walk to a huge variety of restaurants and shopping nearby. We found our room to be clean and comfortable, and the continental breakfast was tasty, and included fresh waffles!

reviews.title: Microtel is My Hotel
reviews.text: The Microtel at Newport News is everything the previous reviewers have claimed. I was just there last Thursday night, and it was great! The front desk staff was friendly and helpful; the room, though small, was clean, quiet and well-equipped with all I needed. It was conveniently located to shops, highway, airport, gas stations, etc. The breakfast wasn't huge or elaborate, but it was sufficient - we're not talking about a gourmet restaurant here. Thanks, Microtel - you made my stay in Newport News, VA, very enjoyable. Also, thanks to the reviewers for the helpful information! :)
